Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: hendbal
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at The Claridge for 3 nights and had a great time, From the moment you walk in to the elegant but cosy reception you know that you have made the right choice. From the first encounter the staff were friendly, attentive and polite. They would try to cater for every requirement that they could. We were shown to our room (no.67) which was on the 6th floor and I couldn't fault it. It was a decent size with a nice bed for my son. The bedding was lovely and the beds firm and comfortable. The bathroom was really big and had a bath and a seperate shower . The view from the room was of one of the side streets and was very Parisien, which is what I wanted. We didn't eat at the hotel but there are plenty of little cafes for breakfast and a huge variety of bistros and restaurants for lunch and dinner. Try Asian for a unique dining experience, just along from the BMW Showroom round the corner from the hotel. Bring plenty of money though because even though I was warned that Paris was expensive it was still a hugely out of pocket experience. A main course and 1 drink can easily set you back £100. The location of the hotel was what made the holiday for us though. A 2 minute walk one way brought you onto the Champs Elysees, turn right and after 5 mins you have reached the Arc de Triumphe. Turn the other way and you will reach Place de la Concorde, the Jardin des Tuileries and then the Louvre. From the hotel walk straight down and in 20-25mins you will reach Les Invalides and up from there the Eiffel Tower. Perfect! This area is also great if you enjoy a little retail therapy at the more expensive end of the market. You are spoiled by choice with all the designer shops like Dior, Vesace, Jimmy Choo, Chanel, to name but a few. If you go further afield you will find plenty of more reasonably priced shops, for Paris anyway. All in all we had a great trip away, just wish we had longer and more (much more!) cash. I will definetally stay at The Claridge the next time I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nell188
Reviews.Content: I got a Groupon deal to stay at this hotel and it was a fantastic deal. The hotel is in an ideal location without being noisy at all, the bedroom was nicely decorated and the bathroom was spacious and very clean. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially Leo who was fantastic at recommending wonderful places to eat nearby. Fortunately, breakfast was included in our Groupon deal, and although it was the continental breakfast that had to be eaten in the room, the fresh juice and pastries were delicious. I probably wouldn't have been able to afford to stay here without the deal I got but for those who can I would certainly recommend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fajuliba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Claridge for 9 nights in February and March '12 our first trip to Paris. This is an excellent hotel in a wonderful, central location. After our first night we had to change rooms because of noise coming from builders renovating on the sixth floor of the building next to the hotel.This was the floor we were on. We changed to a room on the fifth floor and couldn't hear anything. Our second room (53) was smaller than the one on the sixth floor, but I liked it better, it had double doors that opened onto a little balcony. It was beautifully decorated, comfortable bed and bathroom had double sinks everything was spotlessly clean and fresh. All of the staff were excellent, friendly, helpful nothing was a trouble. Breakfast was a little expensive but good. There are lots of good restaurants nearby and the Champs Elysee was about a three minute walk. Our stay at the hotel was amazing and I would definiately recommend it to family and friends . Very french - you could even see the top of Eiffel Tower from outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: 186402John
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a wonderful location. It is very close to the Champs Elysee which is a very fashionable part of Paris. Since the hotel is close to the Paris Metro, the hotel provides an excellent base from which to explore the city. We had a lovely room with a very spacious bathroom. The hotel staff were extremely friendly, helpful and efficient. I booked the hotel through Expedia and thought that the price I paid was very reasonable. The only criticism I would make is that we were disappointed that breakfast was not included in the deal.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice location”
Reviews.Author: StradunApartments
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 9th to 11th of Dec 2011 on our first trip to Paris. The hotel is charming and staff is nice but rooms are quite small for a 4* hotel. Breakfast is good but in my opinion 25 Eur per person for a good (not excellent) breakfast is too much. In any case, I would recommend this hotel to my friends because I am sure no one would be disappointed, especially with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: annievde
Reviews.Content: Very nice rustic hotel, all differents rooms in different style, very special. New renoviation. Very clean and big room with fridge and safe,nice bathroom Wonderfull breakfast with somuch choice of bread, juice, tea, fruit, cereals,yoghurt,cheese, ham, eggs, bacon, you can ask no matter what, they make it Very nice for children aswell People very very nice, very helpful if you need some help I sure will go back overthere. Went there last august 2011

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: goldieOK
Reviews.Content: A convenient hotel and delightful Paris 'headquarters' for our trip. Was recommended by a business traveler and he did us a favor. Great location near the Metro and close to the Champs Elysee - so all the shopping and dining one could wish for. Room was small but nice, wonderful coffee service in the morning and close to the action on Paris Vogue night. Quiet enough for an afternoon nap as well!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a few months”
Reviews.Author: sburke04
Reviews.Content: When my parents and I moved to Paris when I was only five, we stayed at this hotel for a few months till we got situated with our apartment. Yes, the date of my stay is completely wrong but it doesn't give me any earlier dates to use! The hotel looks just the same in the pictures as it did when I was there. It is an incredibly elegant hotel, and surely one of the best there is in the whole city. I have very fond memories of spending Christmas there as we moved during the holidays from the Chicago area. It was the very start and pinnacle of the great childhood I had and memory of the happier times in life. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The location is superb. It really can't be beat if you have the money to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but could be a bit better”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc1958
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Hotel Claridge with overall positive experience. Staff was courteous especially the Viet Namese gentleman who worked the front desk at nights as he was terrific. Hotel is in great location with great shopping, eateries and metro nearby. We did experience some issue with hot water in shower for one day. Was a bit surprised by lack of amenities as a return guest. Was told that one free water bottle given per room on first night only along with instant coffee for use in the in-room coffee maker. They were charging 10 euro for a bottle of water that you could have purchased across the street for 1 euro, which we actually did. There is also a nice food market just across the street with good value. Sometimes it just takes a little extra to make the experience so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Just Minutes from the Champs Elysees!”
Reviews.Author: SusanD2370
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris and our stay at the Hotel Claridge. The accomodations were excellent - we booked a junior suite for 6 nights and couldn't have had a better experience! Great location just minutes from the Champs Elysees and several metro stops plus the RER to Versailles. Majority of staff spoke English and were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and well appointed with free in-room wi-fi. Overall an outstanding experience. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Claridge again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mercerdkny
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful night at Hotel Claridge. My husband and I booked the hotel last minute and we enjoyed the promotion price! Our standard room was huge, by Paris standards and we had a little balcony. The place was very clean and the bathrooms were updated. It felt very Parisian. The room a was a bit noisy, with the street below, but you expect that when staying in the city. The staff was so friendly and cheerful! Breakfast was an added plus. We wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SmithKay
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was marvelous. The staff were indeed very cheerful and friendly.The room were tiny but had enough stuffed in it. Lovely decor all throughout. Will definitely stay again and also recommend it to all me friends planning paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: Neptuna50
Reviews.Content: We cannot speak highly enough of the Hotel Claridge, because it simply ticked every box that was important to us. Location? Perfect. Cheap taxi ride (Eur 12) from Gard du Nord station. Located just off the Champs Elysses, the road is quaint and perfectly Parisian. We were amazed by the lack of tourists and business of the street, given that it is close to the Champs Elysses. The Chanel boutique, which is featured in the advert with Charlize Theron, is situated at the bottom of the road, which gives you an idea of how picturesque it is. Within a few mins of the metro, we didn't plan to use this but, having often walked across the whole of Paris to see Notre Dame and the Marais district to name but a few, we decided to go with it and thought it was fine and the quickest means of travel at busy times. Room? Perfect. The room which we were given by far surpassed our expectations. It was clean and surprisingly spacious. I think people who complain about the size of rooms in Paris are perhaps used to U.S hotels, where floor space is just thrown at you. It is not necessary for us and we had an abundance of room (i'm 6 ft 2" so would've been aware if it felt cramped). Staff? Superb. They were always extremely helpful and friendly. They gave us advice on places that we might (and always did) like, without applying any pressure. Took a good few tries until they understood that the kettle was broken and needed to be replaced. But that is our fault for not speaking French in their own country and my partner and I must say that this was literally the only thing which was anything but perfect! A truly stylish, romantic and artistic city and, having loved every minute of our stay here, we have to say the Hotel Claridge is all of these things. Wouldn't consider anywhere else for our next stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at Claridge”
Reviews.Author: KGTLTD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Claridge during my last busienss trip with my wife and with all honesty i have been staying in a hotel only 10 steps awy from it for the past 17 years and never knew that Claridge is sucha great hotel. The service is fantastic, the staff is super and all in all the whole stay was great and now they have a new loyal customer for a long time. Next time you are in Paris make sure you try this super nice hotel where you are considered a family memeber and not a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location: good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londonvillage8
Reviews.Content: An excellent location for a short stay in Paris. The elegant lobby and professional and friendly staff gave good first impressions. Staff were difficult to get in front of later as the hotel is busy.... The room sizes vary within the same price bracket, although while we had one of the smallest rooms it was still adequate to use as a base to explore Paris from. Thin walls in our room meant an early wake up when next door ran a bath. Breakfast runs until midday which was generous.....although it didn't look like it got refreshed after 10am. A well-meaning, but not-so-efficient member of staff topped up the items we asked for. All in all, a good (but not brilliant) rate for an excellent location and a very smart hotel with attentive, if busy, staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: RyanXnad
Reviews.Content: - Not children friendly. - Minimal space in rooms. - Low service standards. - Low value for money as compared to other similar hotels in the same area. - Some staff are rude while others are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeMarais
Reviews.Content: The hotel could not have been better. Location is just off the Champs Elysees. The hotel abuts Rue Marbeuf which has wonderful restaurants....Chez Clement was super with rack of lamb special on Sunday. The hotel desk staff was friendly and helpful and you actually got to know them. Buffet breakfast was fantastic with everything from poached eggs to pastries. Fresh fruit, cereals, toasts, cheeses, bacon, eggs, sausages. Well worth the price and sometimes included with room rate. Would definitely stay here again. Room was charming and a huge bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Be carefull! Didn't get to see past the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: FarmerSueD
Reviews.Content: For our romantic night in Paris we carefully chose the Hotel Claridge. We were travelling en masse as a family and my parents in law were having one night there as were my husband and I the next night to take a romantic break from our travelling party of 11. The first night we were told that they were fully booked and a patron was ill so they were sending us to another hotel with an upgraded room. The other hotel, the Alma Royal Melia, was quite a walk away with luggage heading away from the Champs -Elysees, the room my parents in law got was nice but it was hard to tell if it was an upgrade as you can't compare it with a room you haven't seen. I had left my luggage at the Claridge and went back there after settling in the in laws and checked that I would be staying at the Claridge the next night as I didn't want to be doing the luggage moving thing again and was told, "Yes, see you tomorrow night." Then next afternoon I rang the Claridge to confirm again and was told that they weren't sure if we were coming (???) so they had booked out our room but they could arrange other accommodation at the same rate and he would call me back. After waiting for half an hour with our luggage in the lobby of the Disneyland hotel we were staying in, I rang the Claridge back to find out what we were doing and he said he couldn't get on to my mobile phone (yet, I could call him) and he had accommodation for us. I stupidly agreed to this only to find we were at the same hotel my in laws were put in. I was dissappointed at the location but I had seen the inside of my in laws room and was a little comforted as it was quite nice (although I had expected more for over 200 Euros/night). After travelling for an hour on the train and getting a taxi to the hotel, we got into our room, our noses were immediately assaulted by cigarette smell and I saw that we had the budget room of this hotel, a bathroom you could barely open the door into with and a hard, double bed with one pillow each. I rang reception and told them that being a non smoker, I needed a non smoking room and they told me that they didn't know this and the only room they had available was on the smoking floor. No, they didn't have air freshener either. It was clearly stated on my booking at the Claridge that our room was to be strictly non smoking but apparently there's a communication problem there. Spent the night sneezing which eventually diabled my ability to smell, thank goodness, but swollen, irritated eyes and a running nose are not romantic. It makes me sick to my stomach every time I think of the amount of money I spent on this experience and what was possibly my only visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoDoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Claridge hotel for 2 nights and should admit that it was a nice surprise to discover a spacious typicaly Parisian-style decorated room with a big comfortable bed, big bathroom with bath tube and double sink. The hotel is very central and located next to shopping area and many excellent restaurants, Fermette de Marbeuf our favorite one just a short walk away! The only negative point for the room we stayed in was the (too) thin door separating us from the noisy giggling neighbors in the room next door. Breakfast in the hotel was fare but we took it with pleasure as it was included in the room rate but it is not worth another 24 euros if not included. All in all if we find a good promotion we will be happy to come back.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Claridge Bellman
HotelInfo.Address: 37 rue Francois Premier | 08 Arr., 75008 Paris, France
